channel.title: World
channel.description: The Washington Post World section provides information and analysis of breaking world news stories. In addition to our world news and video, Post World News offers discussions and blogs on major international news and economic issues.

item.title: Live Briefing: Israeli leaders to convene Tuesday to discuss cease-fire deal with Lebanon, Israeli officials say
item.dc:creator: Rachel Pannett, Annabelle Timsit, Lior Soroka, Suzan Haidamous, Mohamad El Chamaa
item.description: Intense negotiations over the last week have brought Israel and Lebanon closer to a deal, but it has not yet been finalized.

item.title: Israel’s security cabinet to convene Tuesday to discuss Lebanon cease-fire deal
item.dc:creator: Rebecca Tan

item.title: Human Rights Watch: Israel used U.S. device in strike that killed journalists in Lebanon
item.dc:creator: Annabelle Timsit

item.title: Trump and his allies see a role model in Argentina’s Milei
item.dc:creator: Ishaan Tharoor
item.description: The chainsaw-wielding libertarian’s record of slashing government spending has won him admirers in Trumpworld.

item.title: Director of one of last functioning hospitals in northern Gaza is injured
item.dc:creator: Niha Masih, Jennifer Hassan, Leo Sands, Amanda Coletta
item.description: Hussam Abu Safiya said earlier that Kamal Adwan Hospital had been attacked seven times in a day. Also, the body of missing rabbi Zvi Kogan was found in the UAE.

item.title: Israel nowhere near finishing war in Gaza, security cabinet member says
item.dc:creator: Rebecca Tan

item.title: U.S. condemns killing of Israeli Moldovan rabbi in UAE
item.dc:creator: Rachel Pannett, Alexandra Ma

item.title: Special relationship? Trump and U.K.’s Starmer may not be great chums.
item.dc:creator: William Booth
item.description: President-elect Donald Trump and British Prime Minister Keir Starmer could hardly be more different. And Trump isn’t keen on Starmer’s Labour Party.

item.title: Fire destroys more than 1,000 homes in Philippine shantytown
item.dc:creator: Leo Sands
item.description: The fire spread rapidly through makeshift homes in Manila’s Tondo district, an official said, displacing 1,000 families. “It’s like you lit up a box of matches.”

item.title: Body of rabbi found in the UAE; three arrested
item.dc:creator: Niha Masih, Alon Rom, Leo Sands, Amanda Coletta

item.title: In violent weekend, top E.U. diplomat pours cold water on Lebanon cease-fire
item.dc:creator: Abbie Cheeseman

item.title: Missing rabbi found dead in UAE; Israel blames ‘antisemitic terror’
item.dc:creator: Amanda Coletta, Niha Masih, Alon Rom, Leo Sands
item.description: Rabbi Zvi Kogan, 28, was living in Abu Dhabi with his wife as a representative of the Chabad-Lubavitch movement.

item.title: Fighting in Lebanon intensifies around Israel’s deepest known advances
item.dc:creator: Abbie Cheeseman, Suzan Haidamous

item.title: Director of northern Gaza’s Kamal Adwan Hospital wounded, official says
item.dc:creator: Niha Masih, Hajar Harb, Jennifer Hassan

item.title: War fatigue deepens in Israel as deaths mount and fighting expands
item.dc:creator: Shira Rubin

item.title: War fatigue deepens in Israel as deaths mount and fighting expands
item.dc:creator: Shira Rubin
item.description: A growing number of Israeli reservists are choosing not to report for duty, putting further strain on an overextended military amid an ever-widening war.

item.title: Deadly Israeli strike in Beirut adds to fears the war is escalating
item.dc:creator: Kareem Fahim, Suzan Haidamous
item.description: Saturday’s attack completely demolished a multistory building in a densely populated neighborhood. Israel did not say who the strike’s target was.

item.title: Israel investigates disappearance of Chabad emissary
item.dc:creator: Rebecca Tan, Bryan Pietsch

item.title: 20 killed, dozens injured in massive strike on central Beirut
item.dc:creator: Kareem Fahim, Frances Vinall, Suzan Haidamous, Rebecca Tan, Victoria Bisset, Bryan Pietsch
item.description: The target of the attack on the Basta area was not immediately clear. The Israel Defense Forces did not appear to have posted an evacuation order for that area beforehand.

item.title: Northern Gaza hospital attacked 7 times in one day, director says
item.dc:creator: Rebecca Tan

item.title: Pete Hegseth’s Army unit in Iraq was rocked by a war-crimes case
item.dc:creator: Dan Lamothe
item.description: Donald Trump’s defense secretary pick was not involved in the murder of detainees, but the formative experience influenced his advocacy for troops accused of war crimes.
